# load()

**Type Method**

Invoked whenever a class or category is added to the Objective-C runtime; implement this method to perform class-specific behavior upon loading.

## Declaration

```swift
class func load()
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/load()] message is sent to classes and categories that are both dynamically loaded and statically linked, but only if the newly loaded class or category implements a method that can respond.

The order of initialization is as follows:

1. All initializers in any framework you link to.
2. All `+load` methods in your image.
3. All C++ static initializers and C/C++ `__attribute__(constructor)` functions in your image.
4. All initializers in frameworks that link to you.

In addition:

- A class’s `+load` method is called after all of its superclasses’ `+load` methods.
- A category `+load` method is called after the class’s own `+load` method.

In a custom implementation of [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/load()] you can therefore safely message other unrelated classes from the same image, but any [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/load()] methods implemented by those classes may not have run yet.



## Initializing a Class

- **initialize()**: Initializes the class before it receives its first message.
